trans-unit.source: There are two conditions which cause [#$sg3] to reach out to a server. They are discovery and polling.

seg-source.mrk: There are two conditions which cause [#$sg3] to reach out to a server.

target.mrk: There are two conditions which cause [#$sg3] to reach out to a server.

trans-unit.source: During discovery, for WMI, SSH, and VMware protocols, [#$sg4] performs a logon to the target server, and pulls a series of information from the host including server make and model, IP, serial number, OS type, CPU details  (make/model, cache, speed,...), Memory details (make/model, size, type,  ...). SNMP discovery is similar, except no physical logon to the host is required. After initial discovery, a discovery of a Windows or Linux server only needs to occur if the physical hardware changes. Often running discoveries less than once a month is enough but must be based on server changes done in the data center.

seg-source.mrk: During discovery, for WMI, SSH, and VMware protocols, [#$sg4] performs a logon to the target server, and pulls a series of information from the host including server make and model, IP, serial number, OS type, CPU details  (make/model, cache, speed,...), Memory details (make/model, size, type,  ...).
SNMP discovery is similar, except no physical logon to the host is required.
After initial discovery, a discovery of a Windows or Linux server only needs to occur if the physical hardware changes.
Often running discoveries less than once a month is enough but must be based on server changes done in the data center.

target.mrk: During discovery, for WMI, SSH, and VMware protocols, [#$sg4] performs a logon to the target server, and pulls a series of information from the host including server make and model, IP, serial number, OS type, CPU details  (make/model, cache, speed,...), Memory details (make/model, size, type,  ...).
SNMP discovery is similar, except no physical logon to the host is required.
After initial discovery, a discovery of a Windows or Linux server only needs to occur if the physical hardware changes.
Often running discoveries less than once a month is enough but must be based on server changes done in the data center.

trans-unit.source: Polling occurs when [#$sg5]contacts the target server to pull CPU utilization information. In this case, only previously discovered servers are polled. By default,  polls occur every five minutes. This value can be configured using the [#$sg6] GUI to occur as infrequently as every 30 minutes. So having 1000 discovered hosts, you can expect approximately 100k of polling data to be read from servers every 5 minutes. Overall load on the target servers is low. In our labs, we have a large set of [#$sg7]configurations discovering and poling a set of live servers. They are all polling and discovering the same servers 24x365. The average CPU utilization of our idle lab servers (so only [#$sg8]discover and polling is occurring on them) is approximately 3%.

seg-source.mrk: Polling occurs when [#$sg5]contacts the target server to pull CPU utilization information.
In this case, only previously discovered servers are polled.
By default, polls occur every five minutes.
This value can be configured using the [#$sg6] GUI to occur as infrequently as every 30 minutes.
So having 1000 discovered hosts, you can expect approximately 100k of polling data to be read from servers every 5 minutes.
Overall load on the target servers is low.
In our labs, we have a large set of [#$sg7]configurations discovering and poling a set of live servers.
They are all polling and discovering the same servers 24x365.
The average CPU utilization of our idle lab servers (so only [#$sg8]discover and polling is occurring on them) is approximately 3%.

target.mrk: Polling occurs when [#$sg5]contacts the target server to pull CPU utilization information.
In this case, only previously discovered servers are polled.
By default, polls occur every five minutes.
This value can be configured using the [#$sg6] GUI to occur as infrequently as every 30 minutes.
So having 1000 discovered hosts, you can expect approximately 100k of polling data to be read from servers every 5 minutes.
Overall load on the target servers is low.
In our labs, we have a large set of [#$sg7]configurations discovering and poling a set of live servers.
They are all polling and discovering the same servers 24x365.
The average CPU utilization of our idle lab servers (so only [#$sg8]discover and polling is occurring on them) is approximately 3%.

trans-unit.source: WMI connections between hosts require valid user credentials on the remote system.

seg-source.mrk: WMI connections between hosts require valid user credentials on the remote system.

target.mrk: WMI connections between hosts require valid user credentials on the remote system.

trans-unit.source: The credentials should be encrypted on Linux (using j-Interop) as well as Windows (using the  native Windows libraries).

target.mrk: The credentials should be encrypted on Linux (using j-Interop) as well as Windows (using the  native Windows libraries).

trans-unit.source: [#$sg13] polls Windows server WMI namespace. The specified user account must have local administrator access to query disk related details from the namespace.

trans-unit.source: A 1024-bit RSA key is generated and used for SSL communication. The key is self- signed and will generally require the user to trust the signing authority. When connecting to an [#$sg31]server, [#$sg32]presents a dialog asking the user to trust the certificate. The keystore where the RSA key is stored is password protected.

seg-source.mrk: <span class="tx" style="color: rgb(102,102,102);">A 1024-bit RSA key is generated and used for SSL communication.
The key is self- signed and will generally require the user to trust the signing authority.
When connecting to an [#$sg31]server, [#$sg32]presents a dialog asking the user to trust the certificate.
The keystore where the RSA key is stored is password protected.

target.mrk: <span class="tx" style="color: rgb(102,102,102);">A 1024-bit RSA key is generated and used for SSL communication.
The key is self- signed and will generally require the user to trust the signing authority.
When connecting to an [#$sg31]server, [#$sg32]presents a dialog asking the user to trust the certificate.
The keystore where the RSA key is stored is password protected.

trans-unit.source: A software scanning tool is run against every release of the product. The results are investigated and needed action in terms of security updates etc. taken. The scanning tool used is named Nessus.

seg-source.mrk: A software scanning tool is run against every release of the product.
The results are investigated and needed action in terms of security updates etc.
The scanning tool used is named Nessus.

target.mrk: A software scanning tool is run against every release of the product.
The results are investigated and needed action in terms of security updates etc.
The scanning tool used is named Nessus.

trans-unit.source: Nessus is a network vulnerability scan utility. It scans the server as a network device and not just a webserver. Please contact us for details.

seg-source.mrk: <span class="tx">Nessus is a network vulnerability scan utility.
It scans the server as a network device and not just a webserver.

target.mrk: <span class="tx">Nessus is a network vulnerability scan utility.
It scans the server as a network device and not just a webserver.

trans-unit.source: Antivirus tools are not provided with the [#$sg43]server installation. Antivirus is allowed on the [#$sg44]server and target client. It is recommended to exclude the data folders for the databases to maintain performance and reduce problems when installing and upgrading ITO software.

seg-source.mrk: Antivirus tools are not provided with the [#$sg43]server installation.
Antivirus is allowed on the [#$sg44]server and target client.
It is recommended to exclude the data folders for the databases to maintain performance and reduce problems when installing and upgrading ITO software.

target.mrk: Antivirus tools are not provided with the [#$sg43]server installation.
Antivirus is allowed on the [#$sg44]server and target client.
It is recommended to exclude the data folders for the databases to maintain performance and reduce problems when installing and upgrading ITO software.
